intro: Hoya corazoniae, commonly known as the Heartleaf Hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Hoya corazoniae is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on other plants without being parasitic. It is popular among plant enthusiasts due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
